001package io.jstach.ezkv.kvs;
002
003import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
004import java.net.URI;
005import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
006import java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException;
007import java.util.ArrayList;
008import java.util.Base64;
009import java.util.EnumSet;
010import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
011import java.util.List;
012import java.util.Map;
013import java.util.Objects;
014import java.util.Set;
015
016import org.jspecify.annotations.Nullable;
017
018import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesFilter.Filter;
019import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesFilter.FilterContext;
020import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.Variables.Parameters;
021
022/**
023 * Represents a resource that contains key-value pairs to be loaded and processed. A
024 * {@code KeyValuesResource} includes a URI, optional parameters, and metadata flags that
025 * determine its behavior during loading.
026 *
027 * <h2>Resource URIs</h2>
028 * <p>
029 * Out of the box, Ezkv supports the following URI schemas:
030 * </p>
031 *
032 * <ul>
033 * <li>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#SCHEMA_CLASSPATH} - classpath
034 * resource</li>
035 * <li>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#SCHEMA_FILE} - file resource</li>
036 * <li>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#SCHEMA_SYSTEM} - System
037 * properties</li>
038 * <li>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#SCHEMA_ENV} - Environment
039 * variables</li>
040 * <li>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#SCHEMA_CMD} - Command line argument
041 * pairs separated by <code>=</code></li>
042 * <li>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#SCHEMA_STDIN} - Allows Unix piping of
043 * key values, often useful for passwords</li>
044 * <li>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#SCHEMA_PROFILE} - Will load multiple
045 * resources based on a CSV of profiles where the profile name replaces part of the
046 * URI</li>
047 * </ul>
048 *
049 * <h2>Resource Keys</h2>
050 * <p>
051 * Resources can have special keys associated with them. The most important key is the
052 * load key ({@link #KEY_LOAD}), which assigns a name to the resource. The resource name
053 * is the text after the {@value #DEFAULT_KEY_PREFIX} + {@value #KEY_LOAD} +
054 * {@value #DEFAULT_KEY_SEP} which becomes the resource name and the value of the key
055 * should be a URI. The resource name must match the regex: {@value #RESOURCE_NAME_REGEX}.
056 * For example <code>_load_myresource=URI</code> would have the {@linkplain #name() name}
057 * "<code>myresource</code>".
058 * </p>
059 * <p>
060 * All other keys can be specified in two ways:
061 * </p>
062 * <ol>
063 * <li><strong>In-URI keys</strong>: As query parameters in the resource's URI (these keys
064 * will be removed before the resource is loaded).</li>
065 * <li><strong>In-Resource keys</strong>: As additional key-value pairs within the same
066 * resource, using the resource name as part of the key (they keys will be removed from
067 * the final result).</li>
068 * </ol>
069 *
070 * <em>The parameters are combined from both the "In-URI keys" and "In-Resource keys" but
071 * "In-Resource keys" take prededence on collision.</em> One advantage that "In-URI keys"
072 * have is that they do not need the resource name as that can be deduced and order is
073 * guaranteed which is important for filters.
074 *
075 * <table class="table">
076 * <caption><strong>Resource Keys using default syntax</strong></caption> <thead>
077 * <tr>
078 * <th>Resource Key(s)</th>
079 * <th>Resource Syntax</th>
080 * <th>URI Syntax</th>
081 * <th>Description</th>
082 * </tr>
083 * </thead> <tbody>
084 * <tr>
085 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_LOAD}</td>
086 * <td><code>_load_[resource]</code></td>
087 * <td><strong>N/A</strong></td>
088 * <td>Specifies a resource to load. The resource name is defined as the content following
089 * <code>_load_</code>. It should be alphanumeric with no spaces.</td>
090 * </tr>
091 * <tr>
092 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_FLAGS} or
093 * {@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_FLAG}</td>
094 * <td><code>_flags_[resource]</code></td>
095 * <td><code>_flags</code></td>
096 * <td>Defines flags associated with a resource. Replace <code>[resource]</code> with the
097 * actual resource name.</td>
098 * </tr>
099 * <tr>
100 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_MEDIA_TYPE} or
101 * {@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_MIME}</td>
102 * <td><code>_mediaType_[resource]</code></td>
103 * <td><code>_mediaType</code></td>
104 * <td>Specifies the media type of a resource. Replace <code>[resource]</code> with the
105 * actual resource name.</td>
106 * </tr>
107 * <tr>
108 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_PARAM} or
109 * {@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_PARM}</td>
110 * <td><code>_param_[resource]_[name]</code></td>
111 * <td><code>_param_[name]</code></td>
112 * <td>Defines parameters associated with a resource. Replace <code>[resource]</code> with
113 * the actual resource name, and <code>[name]</code> with the parameter name, which should
114 * be alphanumeric with no spaces.</td>
115 * </tr>
116 * <tr>
117 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_FILTER} or
118 * {@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_FILT}</td>
119 * <td><code>_filter_[resource]_[filter]</code></td>
120 * <td><code>_filter_[filter]</code></td>
121 * <td>Specifies filters to apply to a resource. Replace <code>[resource]</code> with the
122 * actual resource name, and <code>[filter]</code> with the filter identifier, both of
123 * which should be alphanumeric with no spaces.</td>
124 * </tr>
125 * </tbody>
126 * </table>
127 * <h3>Resource Flags</h3> As mentioned above flags are set with the {@value #KEY_FLAGS}
128 * key.
129 *
130 * <table class="table">
131 * <caption><strong>Resource loading flags</strong></caption> <thead>
132 * <tr>
133 * <th>Flag Value</th>
134 * <th>Description</th>
135 * </tr>
136 * </thead> <tbody>
137 * <tr>
138 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FLAG_NO_REQUIRE}</td>
139 * <td>Indicates that the resource is optional and no error should occur if it is not
140 * found. Synonym: {@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FLAG_OPTIONAL}</td>
141 * </tr>
142 * <tr>
143 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FLAG_SENSITIVE}</td>
144 * <td>Marks the resource as containing sensitive key-value pairs, which should not be
145 * displayed or included in output such as <code>toString</code>.</td>
146 * </tr>
147 * <tr>
148 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FLAG_NO_ADD}</td>
149 * <td>Indicates that the key-value pairs from the resource should only be added to
150 * variables and not to the final resolved key-value set.</td>
151 * </tr>
152 * <tr>
153 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FLAG_NO_INTERPOLATE}</td>
154 * <td>Disables interpolation entirely for key-value pairs loaded from this resource.</td>
155 * </tr>
156 * </tbody>
157 * </table>
158 *
159 * <p>
160 * <em>Note: flags can be negated textual by appending <code>NO_</code> /
161 * <code>NOT_</code> or removing <code>NO_</code> (if present) and are case
162 * insensitive</em>
163 * </p>
164 *
165 * <h3>Resource Filters</h3> As mentioned previously filters are set with the
166 * {@value #KEY_FILTER} key.
167 * <p>
168 * Out of the box, Ezkv supports the following resource filters:
169 * </p>
170 * <table class="table">
171 * <caption><strong>Resource Filters</strong></caption> <thead>
172 * <tr>
173 * <th>Filter</th>
174 * <th>Description</th>
175 * </tr>
176 * </thead> <tbody>
177 * <tr>
178 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FILTER_GREP}</td>
179 * <td>Grep filter, similar to Unix grep, allows picking keys based on matching
180 * regex.</td>
181 * </tr>
182 * <tr>
183 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FILTER_SED}</td>
184 * <td>Sed filter, similar to Unix sed, can rename or delete key-value keys using
185 * substitution (<code>s</code>) or delete (<code>d</code>) commands.</td>
186 * </tr>
187 * <tr>
188 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FILTER_JOIN}</td>
189 * <td>Join filter can join duplicate keys' values with the separator being the expression
190 * akin to <code>String.join(expression)</code>.</td>
191 * </tr>
192 * </tbody>
193 * </table>
194 *
195 * <h4>Filter Target</h4> The {@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FILTER_GREP}
196 * and {@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FILTER_SED} filters by default target
197 * the keys for search and manipulation. These filter can target the value by suffixing
198 * with {@value #FILTER_TARGET_VALUE} or {@link #FILTER_TARGET_VAL}.
199 *
200 * <h3>Example</h3>
201 *
202 * Example usage for building a {@code KeyValuesResource}:
203 * {@snippet :
204 * var resource = KeyValuesResource.builder("classpath:/config.properties")
205 *      .name("config")
206 *      .flags("optional,interpolate")
207 *      .parameter("key1", "value1")
208 *      .sensitive(true)
209 *      .build();
210 * }
211 *
212 * @see KeyValuesServiceProvider
213 * @see KeyValuesLoader.Builder#add(KeyValuesResource)
214 * @see #builder(URI)
215 */
216public sealed interface KeyValuesResource extends NamedKeyValuesSource, KeyValueReference
217                permits InternalKeyValuesResource {
218
219        /**
220         * Resource names must match {@value #RESOURCE_NAME_REGEX} regular expression which is
221         * effectively only alphanumeric and no spaces.
222         */
223        public static final String RESOURCE_NAME_REGEX = "[a-zA-Z0-9]+";
224
225        /**
226         * Indicates that the resource is optional and no error should occur if it is not
227         * found. {@linkplain KeyValuesLoader Loaders} can indicate not found by throwing
228         * either {@link FileNotFoundException} or {@link NoSuchFileException}. If the
229         * resource is missing during a full load it will be logged with
230         * {@link KeyValuesEnvironment.Logger#missing(KeyValuesResource, Exception)}. Note
231         * that a resource may just not have any key values but is still found. By default
232         * resources are normally required to exist.
233         * @see #FLAG_NO_EMPTY
234         */
235        public static final String FLAG_NO_REQUIRE = "NO_REQUIRE";
236
237        /**
238         * A synonym for {@link #FLAG_NO_REQUIRE}.
239         */
240        public static final String FLAG_OPTIONAL = "OPTIONAL";
241
242        /**
243         * A synonym for {@link #FLAG_NO_REQUIRE}.
244         */
245        public static final String FLAG_NOT_REQUIRED = "NOT_REQUIRED";
246
247        /**
248         * Indicates that the resource should not be empty. Typically used to enforce that the
249         * resource contains at least one key-value pair. This is different than
250         * {@link #FLAG_NO_REQUIRE} which is if the resource does not exist at all. By default
251         * empty resources are normally allowed.
252         */
253        public static final String FLAG_NO_EMPTY = "NO_EMPTY";
254
255        /**
256         * Specifies that the resource is locked and its properties should not be overridden.
257         * This is distinct from {@link #FLAG_NO_REPLACE}, which has different semantics.
258         */
259        public static final String FLAG_LOCK = "LOCK";
260
261        /**
262         * Ensures that the resource can only add new key-value pairs and cannot replace
263         * existing ones.
264         */
265        public static final String FLAG_NO_REPLACE = "NO_REPLACE";
266
267        /**
268         * Indicates that the key-value pairs from the resource should only be added to
269         * variables and not to the final resolved key-value set.
270         */
271        public static final String FLAG_NO_ADD = "NO_ADD";
272
273        /**
274         * Indicates that key-value pairs added to variables should not be used for
275         * interpolation purposes.
276         */
277        public static final String FLAG_NO_ADD_VARIABLES = "NO_ADD_VARIABLES";
278
279        /**
280         * Prevents the resource from invoking <code>_load</code> calls to load additional
281         * child resources.
282         */
283        public static final String FLAG_NO_LOAD_CHILDREN = "NO_LOAD_CHILDREN";
284
285        /**
286         * Disables interpolation entirely for key-value pairs loaded from this resource.
287         */
288        public static final String FLAG_NO_INTERPOLATE = "NO_INTERPOLATE";
289
290        /**
291         * Marks the resource as containing sensitive key-value pairs, which should not be
292         * displayed or included in output such as `toString`.
293         */
294        public static final String FLAG_SENSITIVE = "SENSITIVE";
295
296        /**
297         * Hints to filters that they should retain and not alter resource keys.
298         * @see FilterContext#keyValueIgnore()
299         */
300        public static final String FLAG_NO_FILTER_RESOURCE_KEYS = "NO_FILTER_RESOURCE_KEYS";
301
302        /**
303         * Specifies that the resource should not be reloaded once it has been loaded.
304         */
305        public static final String FLAG_NO_RELOAD = "NO_RELOAD";
306
307        /**
308         * Indicates that the resource's properties should inherit from parent or default
309         * configurations.
310         */
311        public static final String FLAG_INHERIT = "INHERIT";
312
313        /**
314         * By default resource keys are prefixed with {@value #DEFAULT_KEY_PREFIX}. Note that
315         * other keys that are not resource keys may have this prefix and will not be filtered
316         * out.
317         */
318        public static final String DEFAULT_KEY_PREFIX = "_";
319
320        /**
321         * By default resource keys use this as separator to separate the resource key and
322         * resource name ({@link #KEY_LOAD}) as well as other key properties (filter id for
323         * {@link #KEY_FILTER} and parameter name for {@link #KEY_PARAM}).
324         */
325        public static final String DEFAULT_KEY_SEP = "_";
326
327        /**
328         * Key to specify a resource to load. The resource name is defined as the content
329         * following * <code>_load_</code>. It should be alphanumeric with no spaces.
330         * @see #RESOURCE_NAME_REGEX
331         */
332        public static final String KEY_LOAD = "load";
333
334        /**
335         * Defines flags associated with a resource.
336         * @see #KEY_FLAG
337         */
338        public static final String KEY_FLAGS = "flags";
339
340        /**
341         * Key for specifying the media type (or file extension) of a resource.
342         * {@link KeyValuesSystem#mediaFinder()} is then typically used for the lookup.
343         * @see #KEY_MIME
344         * @see KeyValuesMedia
345         */
346        public static final String KEY_MEDIA_TYPE = "mediaType";
347
348        /**
349         * Represents the key for specifying parameters associated with a resource and are
350         * usually suffixed with a separator and name of the parameter.
351         */
352        public static final String KEY_PARAM = "param";
353
354        /**
355         * Key for specifying filters to apply to the resource. The name after the last
356         * {@link #DEFAULT_KEY_SEP} is the filter id. The value of the key is the filter
357         * expression and its syntax and semantics vary by filter.
358         * @see KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesFilter
359         * @see #FILTER_SED
360         * @see #FILTER_GREP
361         */
362        public static final String KEY_FILTER = "filter";
363
364        /**
365         * A synonym for {@link #KEY_FLAGS}.
366         */
367        public static final String KEY_FLAG = "flag";
368
369        /**
370         * A synonym for {@link #KEY_MEDIA_TYPE}.
371         */
372        public static final String KEY_MIME = "mime";
373
374        /**
375         * A synonym for {@link #KEY_PARAM}.
376         */
377        public static final String KEY_PARM = "parm";
378
379        /**
380         * A synonym for {@link #KEY_PARAM}.
381         */
382        public static final String KEY_P = "p";
383
384        /**
385         * A synonym for {@link #KEY_FILTER}.
386         */
387        public static final String KEY_FILT = "filt";
388
389        // @formatter:off
390        /**
391         * Classpath resource is loaded using
392         * {@link KeyValuesEnvironment#getResourceStreamLoader()}.
393         *
394         * {@snippet lang=properties :
395         * _load_app=classpath:///app.properties
396         * }
397         */
398        // @formatter:on
399        public static final String SCHEMA_CLASSPATH = "classpath";
400
401        // @formatter:off
402        /**
403         * File resource which is the default if no schema is given.
404         * {@snippet lang=properties :
405         * _load_somefile=file:///./app.properties
406         * _load_another=another.properties
407         * }
408         */
409        // @formatter:on
410        public static final String SCHEMA_FILE = "file";
411
412        /**
413         * System properties which come from
414         * {@link KeyValuesEnvironment#getSystemProperties()}.
415         * <p>
416         * This schema can take a path that fetches a key value, where the value is used as
417         * the source of the key values. If no path is provided, all key values of the
418         * resource will be loaded.
419         *
420         */
421        public static final String SCHEMA_SYSTEM = "system";
422
423        /**
424         * Environment variables which come from {@link KeyValuesEnvironment#getSystemEnv()}.
425         * <p>
426         * This schema can take a path that fetches a key value, where the value is used as
427         * the source of the key values. If no path is provided, all key values of the
428         * resource will be loaded.
429         */
430        public static final String SCHEMA_ENV = "env";
431
432        /**
433         * Command line argument pairs separated by <code>=</code>.
434         * <p>
435         * This schema can take a path that fetches a key value, where the value is used as
436         * the source of the key values. If no path is provided, all key values of the
437         * resource will be loaded.
438         */
439        public static final String SCHEMA_CMD = "cmd";
440
441        // @formatter:off
442        /**
443         * Allows Unix piping of key values, often useful for passwords.
444         * <p>
445         * <code>stdin:///</code> without a path assumes that the entire contents of stdin are
446         * in java.util.Properties key-value format. If this is not the case, it is advisable
447         * to specify _mediaType= explicitly with stdin.
448         * </p>
449         * <code>stdin:///</code> can also bind the input content, parsed as a UTF-8 string,
450         * to the key provided in the URI path.
451         *
452         * {@snippet lang=properties :
453         * _load_stdin=stdin:///db.password?_flag=sensitive,optional
454         * }
455         *
456         * Stdin is retrieved from {@link KeyValuesEnvironment#getStandardInput()}.
457         *
458         */
459        // @formatter:on
460        public static final String SCHEMA_STDIN = "stdin";
461
462        /**
463         * Will load multiple resources based on a CSV of profiles where the profile name
464         * replaces part of the URI.
465         */
466        public static final String SCHEMA_PROFILE = "profile.";
467
468        /**
469         * Grep filter just like unix grep allows pickings keys based on matching regex.
470         * @see #FILTER_GREP
471         */
472        public static final String FILTER_GREP = "grep";
473
474        /**
475         * Sed filter can rename or delete key values keys just like unix sed by substitution
476         * (<code>s</code>) command or delete command (<code>d</code>).
477         * @see #FILTER_GREP
478         */
479        public static final String FILTER_SED = "sed";
480
481        /**
482         * Join filter can join duplicate keys' values with the separator being the expression
483         * akin to <code>String.join(expression)</code>
484         */
485        public static final String FILTER_JOIN = "join";
486
487        /**
488         * This suffix on the end of the filter name will tell filters that support to target
489         * the key. Example: suff?_filter_grep_key=grep_key
490         */
491        public static final String FILTER_TARGET_KEY = "_key";
492
493        /**
494         * This suffix on the end of the filter name will tell filters that support to target
495         * the value. Example: suff?_filter_grep_value=grep_key
496         * @see #FILTER_TARGET_VAL
497         */
498        public static final String FILTER_TARGET_VALUE = "_value";
499
500        /**
501         * Synonym to {@link #FILTER_TARGET_VALUE}.
502         * @see #FILTER_TARGET_VALUE
503         */
504        public static final String FILTER_TARGET_VAL = "_val";
505
506        /**
507         * Returns the URI of the resource.
508         * @return the URI of the resource
509         */
510        @Override
511        public URI uri();
512
513        /**
514         * Returns the parameters associated with the resource which are specified with the
515         * resource key {@value #KEY_PARAM}. Parameters are away to configure custom plugins.
516         * @return the parameters as {@link Parameters}
517         * @see KeyValuesServiceProvider
518         */
519        public Parameters parameters();
520
521        /**
522         * Returns the name of the resource.
523         * @return the name of the resource
524         * @see #RESOURCE_NAME_REGEX
525         */
526        @Override
527        public String name();
528
529        /**
530         * Returns the {@link KeyValue} that references this resource, if any. This is
531         * normally the {@linkplain #KEY_LOAD load key} in the parent resource loaded key
532         * values.
533         * @return the reference {@code KeyValue}, or {@code null} if not applicable
534         */
535        @Override
536        public @Nullable KeyValue reference();
537
538        /**
539         * Returns the media type of the resource, if specified.
540         * @return the media type, or {@code null} if not specified
541         * @see KeyValuesMedia
542         * @see #KEY_MEDIA_TYPE
543         */
544        public @Nullable String mediaType();
545
546        /**
547         * Creates a builder based on the current state of this {@code KeyValuesResource}.
548         * @return a {@code Builder} initialized with the current state
549         */
550        public Builder toBuilder();
551
552        // TODO maybe we do not provide this.
553        /**
554         * Pretty toString of resource.
555         * @return pretty print resource.
556         */
557        default String description() {
558                return "uri='" + uri() + "' name='" + name() + "'" + ", reference="
559                                + KeyValueReference.toStringRef(this.reference());
560        }
561
562        /**
563         * Creates a builder for a {@code KeyValuesResource} from the given URI.
564         * @param uri the URI for the resource
565         * @return a new {@code Builder} instance
566         */
567        public static Builder builder(URI uri) {
568                return new Builder(uri, uriToName(uri));
569        }
570
571        /**
572         * Creates a builder for a {@code KeyValuesResource} from the given URI string.
573         * @param uri the URI string for the resource
574         * @return a new {@code Builder} instance
575         */
576        public static Builder builder(String uri) {
577                return builder(URI.create(uri));
578        }
579
580        private static String uriToName(URI uri) {
581                return Base64.getUrlEncoder()
582                        .withoutPadding()
583                        .encodeToString(uri.toASCIIString().getBytes(StandardCharsets.US_ASCII));
584        }
585
586        /**
587         * Builder class for creating instances of {@code KeyValuesResource}.
588         */
589        public final class Builder {
590
591                URI uri;
592
593                String name;
594
595                final Map<String, String> parameters;
596
597                final EnumSet<LoadFlag> flags;
598
599                final List<Filter> filters;
600
601                @Nullable
602                KeyValue reference;
603
604                @Nullable
605                String mediaType;
606
607                Builder(URI uri, String name) {
608                        this.uri = uri;
609                        this.name = DefaultKeyValuesResource.validateResourceName(name);
610                        this.parameters = new LinkedHashMap<>();
611                        this.flags = EnumSet.noneOf(LoadFlag.class);
612                        this.filters = new ArrayList<>();
613                }
614
615                Builder(URI uri, String name, Map<String, String> parameters, EnumSet<LoadFlag> flags,
616                                @Nullable KeyValue reference, @Nullable String mediaType, List<Filter> filters) {
617                        super();
618                        this.uri = uri;
619                        this.name = DefaultKeyValuesResource.validateResourceName(name);
620                        this.parameters = parameters;
621                        this.flags = flags;
622                        this.reference = reference;
623                        this.mediaType = mediaType;
624                        this.filters = filters;
625                }
626
627                /**
628                 * Sets the URI for the resource. The URI may contain resource keys and for a full
629                 * listing of that syntax see {@link KeyValuesResource}.
630                 * @param uri the URI to set
631                 * @return this builder instance
632                 * @see KeyValuesResource
633                 */
634                public Builder uri(URI uri) {
635                        this.uri = uri;
636                        return this;
637                }
638
639                /**
640                 * Sets the name for the resource. The name should match the regex
641                 * {@link KeyValuesResource#RESOURCE_NAME_REGEX}. The validation however is done
642                 * at build time and not on this call.
643                 * @param name the name to set
644                 * @return this builder instance
645                 */
646                public Builder name(String name) {
647                        this.name = Objects.requireNonNull(name);
648                        return this;
649                }
650
651                /**
652                 * Clears all parameters associated with the resource.
653                 * @return this builder instance
654                 */
655                public Builder clearParameters() {
656                        parameters.clear();
657                        return this;
658                }
659
660                /**
661                 * Adds a parameter key-value pair to the resource.
662                 * @param key the parameter key
663                 * @param value the parameter value
664                 * @return this builder instance
665                 */
666                public Builder parameter(String key, String value) {
667                        parameters.put(key, value);
668                        return this;
669                }
670
671                /**
672                 * Sets the media type for the resource.
673                 * @param mediaType the media type to set and can be the actual media type or the
674                 * file extension.
675                 * @return this builder instance
676                 * @see KeyValuesMedia
677                 */
678                public Builder mediaType(String mediaType) {
679                        this.mediaType = mediaType;
680                        return this;
681                }
682
683                /**
684                 * Sets the media type for the resource.
685                 * @param media the media type to set from {@link KeyValuesMedia#getMediaType()}.
686                 * @return this builder instance
687                 * @see KeyValuesMedia
688                 */
689                public Builder mediaType(KeyValuesMedia media) {
690                        return this.mediaType(media.getMediaType());
691                }
692
693                /**
694                 * Sets or clears the {@value KeyValuesResource#FLAG_NO_INTERPOLATE} flag.
695                 * @param flag whether to set or clear the flag
696                 * @return this builder instance
697                 * @see KeyValuesResource#FLAG_NO_INTERPOLATE
698                 */
699                public Builder noInterpolation(boolean flag) {
700                        LoadFlag.NO_INTERPOLATE.set(flags, flag);
701                        return this;
702                }
703
704                /**
705                 * Sets or clears the {@value KeyValuesResource#FLAG_NO_ADD} flag.
706                 * @param flag whether to set or clear the flag
707                 * @return this builder instance
708                 */
709                public Builder noAdd(boolean flag) {
710                        LoadFlag.NO_ADD.set(flags, flag);
711                        return this;
712                }
713
714                /**
715                 * Marks the resource as sensitive, meaning its values should not be printed.
716                 * @param flag whether to mark the resource as sensitive
717                 * @return this builder instance
718                 * @see KeyValuesResource#FLAG_SENSITIVE
719                 */
720                public Builder sensitive(boolean flag) {
721                        LoadFlag.SENSITIVE.set(flags, flag);
722                        return this;
723                }
724
725                /**
726                 * Marks the resource as not required.
727                 * @param flag true make the resource not required.
728                 * @return this
729                 */
730                public Builder noRequire(boolean flag) {
731                        LoadFlag.NO_REQUIRE.set(flags, flag);
732                        return this;
733                }
734
735                /**
736                 * Marks the resource as not required.
737                 * @param flag true make the resource not required.
738                 * @return this
739                 * @see KeyValuesResource#FLAG_OPTIONAL
740                 */
741                public Builder optional(boolean flag) {
742                        LoadFlag.NO_REQUIRE.set(flags, flag);
743                        return this;
744                }
745
746                Builder _flags(Set<LoadFlag> flags) {
747                        this.flags.clear();
748                        this.flags.addAll(flags);
749                        return this;
750                }
751
752                Builder _addFlag(LoadFlag flag) {
753                        flags.add(flag);
754                        return this;
755                }
756
757                Builder _addFilter(Filter filter) {
758                        filters.add(filter);
759                        return this;
760                }
761
762                /**
763                 * Parses a comma-separated string of resource flags and adds or removes the flags
764                 * from this builder.
765                 *
766                 * <p>
767                 * See the constants on this class for the available flag names. Flags are
768                 * case-insensitive and can be negated or reversed by prefixing them with
769                 * <code>"NO_"</code> or <code>"NOT_"</code>, or by removing these prefixes if
770                 * they are already present. If a flag is specified multiple times in the input
771                 * string, the last occurrence takes precedence.
772                 * </p>
773                 * <p>
774                 * The following demonstrates how to add and reverse resource flags using this
775                 * method:
776                 * </p>
777                 * {@snippet :
778                 * var builder = KeyValuesResource.builder(URI.create("classpath:/config.properties"));
779                 * builder.addFlags("no_require,no_interpolate,sensitive");
780                 *
781                 * // The flags "NO_REQUIRE", "NO_INTERPOLATE", and "SENSITIVE" are added to the builder.
782                 * }
783                 * @param csv a comma-separated, case-insensitive string of flag names
784                 * @return this builder instance for chaining
785                 */
786                public Builder addFlags(String csv) {
787                        LoadFlag.parseCSV(this.flags, csv);
788                        return this;
789                }
790
791                /**
792                 * Builds and returns a {@code KeyValuesResource} based on the current builder
793                 * state.
794                 * @return a new {@code KeyValuesResource} instance
795                 */
796                public KeyValuesResource build() {
797                        return DefaultKeyValuesResource.of(this, false);
798                }
799
800                InternalKeyValuesResource buildNormalized() {
801                        return DefaultKeyValuesResource.of(this, true);
802                }
803
804                // For unit test
805                InternalKeyValuesResource build(KeyValuesResourceParser parser) throws KeyValuesResourceParserException {
806                        return parser.normalizeResource(this.build());
807                }
808
809                @Override
810                public String toString() {
811                        return "KeyValuesResource.Builder[uri=" + uri + ", name=" + name + ", parameters=" + parameters + ", flags="
812                                        + flags + ", reference=" + reference + ", mediaType=" + mediaType + "]";
813                }
814
815        }
816
817}
818
819sealed interface InternalKeyValuesResource extends KeyValuesResource {
820
821        Set<LoadFlag> loadFlags();
822
823        boolean isRedacted();
824
825        public List<Filter> filters();
826
827        boolean normalized();
828
829}
830
831record DefaultKeyValuesResource(URI uri, //
832                String name, //
833                Set<LoadFlag> loadFlags, //
834                @Nullable KeyValue reference, //
835                @Nullable String mediaType, //
836                Parameters parameters, List<Filter> filters, boolean normalized) implements InternalKeyValuesResource {
837
838        DefaultKeyValuesResource {
839                validateResourceName(name);
840                loadFlags = FlagSet.copyOf(loadFlags, LoadFlag.class);
841                filters = List.copyOf(filters);
842        }
843
844        public static String validateResourceName(String identifier) {
845                return KeyValuesSource.validateName(identifier);
846        }
847
848        @Override
849        public Builder toBuilder() {
850                var resource = this;
851                var uri = resource.uri();
852                var name = resource.name();
853                var parameters = new LinkedHashMap<String, String>();
854                resource.parameters().forKeyValues(parameters::put);
855                var flags = FlagSet.enumSetOf(LoadFlag.class, resource.loadFlags());
856                var ref = resource.reference();
857                var mediaType = resource.mediaType();
858                var filters = resource.filters();
859                var b = new KeyValuesResource.Builder(uri, name, parameters, flags, ref, mediaType, filters);
860                return b;
861        }
862
863        static InternalKeyValuesResource of(KeyValuesResource.Builder builder, boolean normalized) {
864                Map<String, String> parameters = new LinkedHashMap<>(builder.parameters);
865                URI uri = builder.uri;
866                String name = builder.name;
867                var reference = builder.reference;
868                var loadFlags = builder.flags;
869                var mediaType = builder.mediaType;
870                Parameters variables = Parameters.of(parameters);
871                var filters = builder.filters;
872                return new DefaultKeyValuesResource(uri, name, loadFlags, reference, mediaType, variables, filters, normalized);
873        }
874
875        @Override
876        public boolean isRedacted() {
877                // TODO hmm if the resource has sensitive info should its URI be redacated as
878                // well?
879                // if (LoadFlag.SENSITIVE.isSet(loadFlags())) {
880                // return true;
881                // }
882                var ref = this.reference();
883                if (ref == null) {
884                        return false;
885                }
886                return ref.isSensitive();
887        }
888
889}
